items.title: At $280, Lenovo’s Chromebook Duet 11 with keyboard and pen costs less than an iPad Magic Keyboard today ($120 off)
items.summary:
As part of its Fall Tech Fest sale, Lenovo is offering its Chromebook Duet 11 Gen 9 model with 8GB RAM for $279.99 shipped. This is regularly a $400 unit, which is now seeing a 30% markdown to save you $120. That puts it just $5 above its all-time low and actually cheaper than the 4GB RAM version that’s still selling for $379. Lenovo is also including a Folio Keyboard with a stand and a USI Pen 2 for free to make this an even better deal. That’s a pretty solid value considering this bundle costs less than Apple’s Magic Keyboard alone at $299, which doesn’t even include an iPad. Head below for more details.

items.title: Remove spots, stains, odors, and hair with Shark’s StainStriker HairPro portable cleaner at $130 (Reg. $170)
items.summary:
Amazon is offering the Shark StainStriker HairPro Portable Carpet, Upholstery, and Area Rug Cleaner back at $129.99 shipped. Normally, you would pay $170 for this upgraded model at full price, which is not only beating out the current $139 price on its standard variant, but has also regularly been falling to this rate throughout the year, only beaten by a one-time fall lower to $129. You’re getting the next-best deal once again while the savings last, which cuts $40 off the tag.

more…

items.title: Be prepared for almost anything with this magnetic multi-USB cable and adapter kit, now $13.50
items.summary:
Elebase Multi-USB Cable and Adapter Kit

Buy for $13.50 (Reg. $15)

Clip the on-page 10% off coupon.

What we love

While most of just want to skip to a world where just about everything uses USB-C, we aren’t there yet, and who knows if we ever will be. That said, a versatile kit like this can help you interact with various types of ports thanks to various adapters that can be found inside of the magnetic case. Examples include a compact 100W USB-C cable, adapters ranging from USB-A to microUSB, Lightning, and more.

items.summary:
Today is your very last chance to take advantage of the 25% off sitewide savings we have secured for readers this week. Over the last week, all 9to5 readers have been privy to 25% in savings on just everything Satechi sells on its site, from the latest collection of Find My accessories through to all of its wonderful MagSafe charging stands, and even the Mac mini Stand & Hub that has been quite popular among owners of Apple’s latest M4 headless Mac. But today is your very last chance to make use of our exclusive 9to5Fall discount code and we wanted to make sure you didn’t miss out.

items.title: Add this 57W USB-C car charger with retractable USB-C to your ride for $13 Prime shipped
items.summary:
LISEN 57W Retractable USB-C Car Charger

Buy for $13 (Reg. $15)

Clip the on-page $2 off coupon.

What we love

Retractable USB-C cables offer up one of the cleanest and versatile ways to top off a wide variety of devices. This car charger delivers an integrated 30-inch USB-C cord that you can simply tug when you need it, and tug again once you’re finished to make it disappear. You will also find both USB-A and Type-C ports up for grabs as well.

items.title: Autel’s new Home 3000 portable 3,072Wh LiFePO4 power station with an AI voice assistant hits a new $1,659 low ($400 off)
items.summary:
By way of its official Amazon storefront, Autel is offering the best price yet on its new Home 3000 AI-supported Portable Power Station for $1,659 shipped, after clipping the on-page $400 off coupon, beating out the brand’s direct website pricing by $40. While it’s been on the market since April, it only became available on Amazon in early August, which we’ve seen taken down to $1,689 once before. That price is getting beaten out by the deal popping up today, which cuts $400 off the going rate for the all-time lowest price we have tracked.

items.title: Rad Power Bikes drops RadRover 6 Plus e-bike to second-ever all-time $1,199 low in weekend flash sale (Reg. $1,599)
items.summary:
Running alongside its ongoing Fall Savings Sale with several e-bike bundles (including extra batteries), Rad Power has launched a weekend flash sale through September 21 that is giving us a second-ever chance at the best price on its RadRover 6 Plus Fat-Tire e-bike for $1,199 shipped. Coming down from its $1,599 price tag, we usually see this model drop between $1,399 and $1,299 over 2025, with only one previous fall to this all-time low rate that occurred back in January. Now it’s coming back to save you $400 at the best price we have tracked, equipping your commutes and joyrides across any terrain with a reliable and durable model that has been a favorite of my family for years.
